biogHist.abstract: Hillcrest Photos is a lever-arch file that contains information and images relating mostly to the Salvation Army's Hillcrest Maternity Hospital in North Fremantle and The Open Door (Hopetoun) Maternity Home that preceded it, but there are references to other Homes operated by the Salvation Army. This file is part of the Salvation Army Heritage Museum WA, Children's Homes Files series of records held at the museum. There are no personal records in the file, but there are images of babies and children.
biogHist.p: Access to most items in the file is open, but it is essential to make an appointment to view.

Hillcrest Photos contains information and images that relate mostly to Hillcrest and The Open Door (Hopetoun). However, there is also one item, a services pamphlet from the 1960s, that has information relevant to the Salvation Army's Girls' Home, Cottesloe; the Salvation Army Boys' Home, Nedlands; Withnell House; and Graceville.

cpfRelation.relationEntry: Salvation Army Heritage Museum WA - Contact Details

resourceRelation.relationEntry: 'Hillcrest Photos', in Find & Connect - Western Australia,

archref.repository: Salvation Army Heritage Museum WA, Hillcrest photos file
archref.abstract: 'SA Hospital North Fremantle' is a digital copy of an undated photograph held in the Hillcrest photos file at the Salvation Army Heritage Museum WA. It shows the Salvation Army's maternity hospital, Hillcrest.

resourceRelation.relationEntry: Pied Piper Cottage at the Hollywood Children's Village

archref.repository: Salvation Army Heritage Museum WA, Hillcrest photos file
archref.unittitle: Pied Piper Cottage at the Hollywood Children's Village
archref.abstract: 'Pied Piper Cottage at the Hollywood Children's Village' is a digital copy of an image from the pamphlet, Serving the community in Western Australia, that is held in the Hillcrest photos file at the Salvation Army Heritage Museum WA. The image dates from the period before girls were admitted to the Village, which was also known at that time as the Salvation Army Boys' Home, Nedlands.

archref.repository: Salvation Army Heritage Museum WA, Hillcrest photos file
archref.abstract: 'Hillcrest, North Fremantle, 1921' is a digital copy of a photocopied page from the book, Property Souvenir, Australia; a record of progress, 1909-1921 (p.42). The excerpt is held in the Hillcrest photos file at the Salvation Army Heritage Museum WA. The caption reads in part, 'Mrs. F.C. Pearse transferred "Hillcrest" in fulfilment of the desires of her late husband' and dates the image as 1921. Another version of the image is held in the same file and comes from The War Cry dated (by hand) 14 May 1921, with the caption: 'Hillcrest as viewed from Helen Street. The Coachman's House and Motor Garage are seen on the right'.

resourceRelation.relationEntry: Hillcrest Hospital 1958, old and new wings

archref.repository: Salvation Army Heritage Museum WA, Hillcrest photos file
archref.unittitle: Hillcrest Hospital 1958, old and new wings
archref.abstract: 'Hillcrest Hospital 1958, old and new wings' is a digital copy of a photograph held in the Hillcrest photos file at the Salvation Army Heritage Museum WA. The caption reads, 'Hillcrest Hosp. 1958'. It shows the new wing of the hospital, which had been built in 1957, to the right of the original building.

archref.repository: Salvation Army Heritage Museum WA, Hillcrest photos file
archref.abstract: 'Hopetoun North Fremantle' is a digital copy of an undated, mounted photocopy held in the Hillcrest photos file at the Salvation Army Heritage Museum WA. The caption reads, 'Hopetoun - opened 1910 on corner of Stirling Hwy and Harvest Rd'. There is some confusion about when the maternity home came to be called 'Hopetoun'. Until at least 1918, it was also called 'The Open Door'. The earliest published account of the name 'Hopetoun' is 1916, so there was some overlap. By 1922, the maternity services had moved into another property in Harvest Road, 'Hillcrest'. The Hopetoun building was used as an aged care facility. From around June 1906, the building had been used as a prison-gate home. It is unknown what purpose the building served when this photograph was taken.

archref.repository: Salvation Army Heritage Museum WA, Hillcrest photos file
archref.abstract: 'Hillcrest in North Fremantle' is a digital copy of an undated photograph held in the Hillcrest photos file at the Salvation Army Heritage Museum WA, showing its position high on the hill.

archref.repository: Salvation Army Heritage Museum WA, Hillcrest photos file
archref.abstract: 'Hillcrest exterior view, side (II)' is a digital copy of an undated photograph held in the Hillcrest photos file at the Salvation Army Heritage Museum WA. It shows the covered verandahs at the side and rear of the main building.

archref.repository: Salvation Army Heritage Museum WA, Hillcrest photos file
archref.abstract: 'Hillcrest exterior view, front' is a digital copy of an undated photograph held in the Hillcrest photos file at the Salvation Army Heritage Museum WA. It shows the original 'Hill Crest' building frontage.
